ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: I wasn't super impressed with the quality of the average research presented--I think I'd enjoy this more if we could bring in some more compelling researchers. Some of the material was presented at too low of a level for its audience, and it was kind of frustrating to sit through some of the less-interesting talks knowing that there's such a huge amount of interesting research going on in the world of health care. It'd be great to get a wider variety of guests as well--physician-researchers as well as Ph.D.'s
Good examples of current work in HPM fields

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Jody Sindelar  Jody is wonderful, and asks excellent and compelling questions. Her presence and participation in the talks adds a (often much-needed) degree of passion that draws the rest of the audience in.
Instructor: Zachary Noel Cooper  Zach is a great facilitator and asks important, thoughtful, and clear questions.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I have high hopes for these seminars in the future--it'd be great to get researchers who are clearly incredibly excited about their research to come and present (e.g. more like Mike Chernew!)
